metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1783 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 9.3, Safari before 9.1, and tvOS before 9.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1783` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.9-1ubuntu1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
